metadata.synopsis: The inquisitor demands the Orpheus artefact. The player can ask questions or attempt to hand over the artefact, which leads to Vlaakith appearing through the planecaster. Vlaakith explains that there's a prisoner inside who needs to be killed for the safety of the gith and teleports the player into the Astral Prison. Alternatively the player can kill the inquisitor and prompt Vlaakith’s appearance themselves.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Enter the security office room in the lower gith creche or get spotted while sneaking into it. Detect thoughts is a useful spell to have for this dialogue.

129.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
129.text: My ardents spoke of one of our kin that escaped a crashing ghaik slave-vessel.

92.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
92.text: You have accomplished much, child. I am pleased to finally meet you.

79.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
79.text: Interesting. My ardents reported that an istik survived the crashed ghaik slave-vessel.

15.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
15.text: You have accomplished much since. I am pleased to finally meet you.

91.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
91.text: I heard there is so much goblin blood on your hands that it soaks their children's nightmares.

41.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
41.text: Kith'rak Voss' made a mistake when he let you go.

115.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
115.text: To business. I suspect you plucked something precious from the ghaik ship. Something that belongs to us.

104.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
104.text: The weapon. Give it to me.

99.speaker: Narrator
99.text: *The artefact stirs in your pocket. Right within your grasp, and desperate not to be relinquished.*

164.text: Don't do it. The weapon is how I protect you.

90.speaker: Lae'zel
90.text: Do it. Do not disobey the Inquisitor.

61.speaker: Player
61.text: I can give it to you, but I don't think you'll like it.

59.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
59.text: Perhaps you should leave the thinking to me, istik. Hand over the weapon.

106.speaker: Player
106.text: This weapon - what does it do?

148.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
148.text: What business is that of yours? Suffice to say, my queen wants it.

54.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
54.text: But know that you will have been instrumental in stopping the Grand Design.

70.speaker: Player
70.text: Is the ghaik incursion not more important?

160.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
160.text: You mean the Grand Design? The restoration of the Illithid Empire? Why, it is of the utmost importance.
160.context: NodeContext: as if talking about something super obvious that you're an idiot not to have heard of

142.speaker: Player
142.text: Shouldn't you be more concerned with the mind flayer invasion?

37.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
37.text: What makes you think we are not? We are talking about the Grand Design - the restoration of the Illithid Empire. There is nothing of greater importance.
37.context: NodeContext: as if talking about something super obvious that you're an idiot not to have heard of

103.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
103.text: But the weapon is the solution. I have heard it directly from Queen Vlaakith herself.

109.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
109.text: It is how we will stop the mind flayers before they destroy us all.

113.speaker: Player
113.text: How do you know so much about me?

118.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
118.text: Some of your species say knowledge is power. They are wrong. Knowledge is everything.

10.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
10.text: Indeed? And what does it protect you from?

73.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
73.text: Well you know what they say about fears. The best thing you can do is face them.

56.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
56.text: Here. Let me put your lights out. Hta'zith!

43.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
43.text: If you hear that voice at all, then you are infected.

66.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
66.text: And it is my people who need protecting from you. Hta'zith!

86.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
86.text: No matter. Death will cure you of that problem.

128.speaker: Player
128.text: All kinds of bad things. It's my lucky charm.

4.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
4.text: You really have no idea what it is, do you?

139.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
139.text: But you were not wrong to observe that you need protection.

96.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
96.text: Once the Grand Design comes into effect and the Illithid Empire is restored, all life will be over as you know it.

9.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
9.text: We took an interest in you when you became involved with this 'Absolute' cult. A pestilence of infected slaves - the first symptom of the Grand Design in action.

78.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
78.text: But you are lucky - that weapon you carry is the solution. I have heard it from Queen Vlaakith herself.

28.speaker: Player
28.text: What do I get in return if I give it to you?

11.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
11.text: The ghaik are about to execute their Grand Design and you seek to bargain. P'hak'va.

100.speaker: Player
100.text: I have the weapon - I would say that puts me in a strong position to bargain with you.

75.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
75.text: Is that so? Well, then - humour me. What would you ask of an Inquisitor?
75.context: InternalNodeContext: He's only playing along for his own entertainment. He doesn't believe we have anything to offer him. NodeContext: Bemused, snarky

154.speaker: Player
154.text: Make me your best offer. I accept gold.

83.speaker: Player
83.text: I could use an ally against the illithids. As could you.

124.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
124.text: If you desire to see the might of my people, you will not be disappointed.

126.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
126.text: Our swords are ready to cleave ghaik flesh in their legions. With or without your interference.

26.speaker: Player
26.text: Give me a treasure from the Githyanki Empire's coffers. One of immense power.

125.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
125.text: You would lay claim to our hard-won treasures? You seek power but do not seek to strive for it?

136.speaker: Player
136.text: Coin, typically - but anything of immense value will do.

159.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
159.text: You hold the key to thwarting the ghaik Grand Design - and you ask me for coin? Petty trinkets?

112.speaker: Player
112.text: I bet your empire has gathered countless valuable spellbooks in its time - let me read them.

116.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
116.text: You stand before an Inquisitor of Vlaakith and ask for... reading material?

55.speaker: Player
55.text: You githyanki are disciplined warriors - I wish to learn your ways.

138.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
138.text: Gish war-arts far eclipse the reckoning of istik minds.

76.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
76.text: However, you will readily witness our silver swords cleave putrid ghaik flesh if you do but one thing -

95.speaker: Player
95.text: A promotion in the eyes of our Queen. I want my silver sword.

123.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
123.text: Only this? Gladly. Once you hand me the artefact.
123.context: InternalNodeContext: You had the chance to negotiate for something more and blew it on something he was going to give you anyway.NodeContext: with ridicule

6.speaker: Player
6.text: On second thoughts, I don't need anything of yours.

94.speaker: Player
94.text: Here's how deals like this work: I have something you need. I can bargain all I like.

98.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
98.text: I do not know what base, naive entities you have made deals with before - nor do I care.

31.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
31.text: But I will humour your greed for a moment. What would you ask of an Inquisitor?

25.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
25.text: The Grand Design is what all ghaik seek. The restoration of the Illithid Empire, which spanned the entirety of the multiverse.

166.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
166.text: For centuries, their elder brains sought to bring back their dominion. Every plot they hatched, we stopped. But now, they are close to succeeding.

65.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
65.text: Never before could they pause ceremorphosis. Never before could they let the infection spread undetected.

23.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
23.text: Imagine that everywhere. Wants, needs, choice - all would cease to be.

2.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
2.text: This is what we have all been training for.

57.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
57.text: You saw the thralls gathered on the ghaik ship.

5.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
5.text: It was a vision of the future. Luckily, our queen is here to guide us. She will lead us to victory.

131.speaker: Player
131.text: I won't let you take it.

102.speaker: Lae'zel
102.text: Do not try me. Hand over the artefact, or die by my hand.
102.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to playerNodeContext: Threatening and confident. She means what she says.

122.speaker: Player
122.text: You can't trust him, Lae'zel. Follow my lead. I will choose the right path.

127.speaker: Lae'zel
127.text: Tsk - tsk - tsk'va! I hate that you speak the truth.
127.context: NodeContext: tsk tsk tsk-VA! Basically saying, SHIT SHIT SHIT!

158.speaker: Lae'zel
158.text: Choose. Your path is mine to follow.

81.speaker: Lae'zel
81.text: I know my path. Refuse him the artefact, and it will run with your blood.

144.speaker: Player
144.text: You can't trust him, Lae'zel. Follow my lead. I will choose the right path.

0.speaker: Player
0.text: Remember the zaith'isk? These gith can't be trusted. Follow my lead - I'll choose the right path.

64.speaker: Lae'zel
64.text: The zaith'isk... Tsk - tsk - tsk'va! I hate that you speak the truth.
64.context: NodeContext: tsk tsk tsk-VA! Basically saying, SHIT SHIT SHIT!

30.speaker: Lae'zel
30.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to player.NodeContext: Seething anger, quiet but roiling.

16.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
16.text: Your illustrious adventure ends here. Hta'zith!

62.speaker: Lae'zel
62.text: Our fate is forged. Mother Gith, guide us!
62.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to player.NodeContext: Gearing up for battle

29.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The player reaches to produce the artefact. 
The inquisitor reaches to take it but is interrupted.

151.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
151.text: Then your illustrious adventure ends here. Hta'zith!

72.speaker: Player
72.text: I thought the Grand Design was a ghaik philosophy, not an actual plan.

53.speaker: Player
53.text: How will this weapon stop the mind flayers?

101.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
101.text: That is a secret known only to Queen Vlaakith. Its significance is beyond both of our stations.

143.speaker: Player
143.text: How will this weapon actually stop the ghaik?

17.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
17.text: Did your crèche teach you nothing? That knowledge belongs to Queen Vlaakith alone. It is not for us to know nor question.

157.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
157.text: You know more than you're letting on.

132.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
132.text: I have seen your behaviour before. The squirming, the avoidance. You are infected.

162.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
162.text: You also killed Sarth Baretha. She was formidable.

108.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
108.text: I heard enough druids died by your hand to make the deity Silvanus himself weep.

45.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
45.text: It must not have been easy to escape.

114.speaker: Player
114.text: My mind is silver, and my body steel. Vlaakith expects no less of me.

120.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
120.text: Place the weapon in the planecaster. Fulfil our Queen's most holy edict.
